appearances.title: Q&A Rep. James Clyburn D-SC on Pioneering Black Congressmen from South Carolina : CSPAN3 : January 1, 2026 9:52am-10:55am EST
appearances.snippet: clyburn: i get along famously with joe wilson, ok with nancy mace. get along too well with ralph norman. ralph is part of the freedom caucus, and for some strange reason he thinks that because republicans get 53% of the vote in south carolina they are deserving of 100% of the representation. i don't know how you do that. one of the things people found out about me if they cared to look it up, i started advocating for representation as a 20 something year old. i have written editorials, op-ed pieces for the charleston papers on things like proportional voting, which we used to have. illinois had chemo devoting up to a few years ago. the supreme court in many cases accepted cumulative voting as a way to settle voting rights cases. i still have that. some places have started what they call ranked choice voting, but that is not the only way. cumulative voting as a way to do it. proportional voting is a way to do it. ranked choice voting has caught people's fancy, but i really believe that the justice department and the congress itself would do well to lo

appearances.title: Q&A Rep. James Clyburn D-SC on Pioneering Black Congressmen from South Carolina : CSPAN2 : January 5, 2026 11:49pm-12:54am EST
appearances.snippet: representatives from south carolina one democrat, six republicans, how do you get along with nancy mace and joe wilsona, et cetera. >> i got along famously with wilson. not with norman. ralph is part of freedom caucus and some strangem reason he thinks that because republicans get 52, 53% of the vote in south carolina they are deserving of 100% of the representation. i don't know how you do that. it caught people's fancy but i would really believe that the justice department and the congress itself will look well to look at others but i think it's something untarred of getting 50% plus one further vote and then you get 100% of the power of the office. something is not quite right about that to me. >> could you see the state of north carolina -- south carolina republican governor republican letture redistrict your district which runs from colombia to charleston? >> yeah, i could see it happening. i don't think it will simply because most of people in south carolina, at least political leadership in south carolina don't see it that way. in fact, i would be very surprised if the legislature were to do th
